; Fri, 03 Nov 2023 17:25:03 +0800 清剿电诈还是军阀混战？缅北果敢到底怎么了？http://www.infzm.com/contents/259885
;;2023-11-03 16:00:00;
;

;;

;

;On October 28, 2023, in northern Shan State, Myanmar, a missile struck from a Military base launch;(Visual China/Photo);

;

;October 27, 2023, Myanmar in Lashio, Gwei and other places in northern Myanmar Government military positions were attacked by armed forces and fierce fighting broke out. According to Myanmar's "Kokang Information Network", the Kokang National Democratic Alliance Army issued a statement on the same day claiming responsibility for the armed attack and that the operation was to "clear out the electronic fraud militia." At about 4 a.m. local time on the 27th, the Kokang National Democratic Alliance Army launched attacks on military deployment areas, police posts, toll stations and other strongholds in Qingshui River, Gunong, Lashio and other places in Shan State. At about 5 o'clock, many strategic strongholds including Qingshuihe and Gunong were occupied by the Kokang National Democratic Alliance Army.

;

;On October 27, when the war broke out, at a regular press conference of the Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs, spokesperson Mao Ning said regarding the military conflict that broke out between the Myanmar military and the Myanmar Kokang National Democratic Alliance Army (MNDAA): " China pays close attention to the relevant conflicts and calls on relevant parties to cease fire and end the war as soon as possible, insist on resolving differences through dialogue and consultation through peaceful means, avoid escalation of the situation, and take practical and effective measures to ensure the security and stability of the China-Myanmar border."

;

;In addition to the Myanmar Kokang National Democratic Alliance Army (MNDAA), the Ta'ang National Liberation Army (TNLA) and the Arakan Army (AA) also participated in attacks against Myanmar government forces. According to information from the Kokang Allied Forces, the three anti-government armed forces have a total participation of more than 15,000 troops, and the fighting is mainly concentrated in northern Shan State. This is the largest battle that has broken out in the region since the Kokang War in 2015.

;

;Because the fighting site is close to the China-Myanmar border, there has been a wave of refugees at the border ports. Relevant departments of the Chinese government have begun to provide shelter and assistance to incoming refugees fleeing the war.

;

;But how did the war break out? What impact will it have on the future situation of the region?

;

;;

;

;On October 27, 2023, in Shan State, Myanmar, Major General Peng Deqi (fourth from left) of the Myanmar National Democratic Alliance Army commanded the operation;(Visual China/Photo);

;

;;The battle for survival under the political war;

;

;Although Myanmar is a close neighbor of China, the two sides share more than 2,100 kilometers of border, and Myanmar is the largest country in terms of land area and population among the Southeast Asian countries bordering China. However, for most Chinese, Myanmar is still a relatively unfamiliar country, and its presence is quite limited. There are far fewer Chinese people traveling to Myanmar than to neighboring Southeast Asian countries such as Thailand, Vietnam or Cambodia.

;

;However, in the past two years, Myanmar has gained notoriety in our country's public opinion due to telecom fraud and "Gayaozi" (illegal organ harvesting and trade). With the dissemination of relevant social media information and film and television works, more and more Chinese people have learned that the northern region of Myanmar adjacent to Yunnan is an area where telecommunications fraud and criminal gang activities are rampant, and the local government is helpless and even complicit in this.

;

;On the day when the conflict in northern Myanmar broke out, the Kokang Alliance Army's social media immediately released a statement titled "Myanmar National Democratic Alliance Army, Ta'ang National Liberation Army, and Arakan Army "10.27" Action Statement." mentioned, "We will eradicate telecommunications fraud, fraud dens and their protective umbrellas across the country, including the China-Myanmar border areas. The three coalition forces decided to jointly carry out this military operation."

;

;This statement After the release, the propaganda of these three ethnic and local armed forces continued to contain content about destroying telecom fraud gangs and saving trapped compatriots. Among them, the Kokang Allied Forces even released a pre-war mobilization video of a unit of the Allied Forces on the short video social platform. The brigade commander who issued the mobilization order said in a solemn tone: Our mission is to eradicate the electronic fraud group, eliminate drugs, and rescue our compatriots. no confidence!

;

;Then the soldiers in uniform shouted in unison: Yes! have! have!

;

;They are not just a bunch of people who shout loud slogans. When it comes to fighting, the Kokang Allied Forces have always been good at attacking. As early as the Kokang War in 2015, the Allied Forces launched an attack under the eyes of the Myanmar government forces. Not only did the vanguard troops enter Lao Cai, the capital of the Kokang region, on the day the war started, but they also later sniped and killed a Myanmar Army deputy from a distance behind enemy lines. brigadier.

;

;At the last moment of the Kokang War that year, the Kokang Allied Forces defended the Nantianmen Highlands at an altitude of more than 2,000 meters in the north of Lao Cai for two months despite the artillery fire and aircraft bombings of the Burmese army. In the end, the Burmese army launched a general offensive. , none of the more than 20 defenders who held on to the end surrendered and all died in the battle. Their fighting will shocked even the opponent Burmese army.

;

;In the conflict on October 27, the Kokang Allied Forces performed even more rapidly. Within just a few days of the war, they quickly occupied the Qingshui River area adjacent to Lao Cai and an important port with China. , captured more than 60 Burmese army strongholds, successfully relied on light infantry to destroy 6 armored vehicles, and completely wiped out the Burmese airborne special forces who came to provide parachute support. Under the rapid offensive of the Allied Forces, a battalion of Myanmar government officers and soldiers organized and surrendered.

;

;The Arakan Army and the Ta’ang National Liberation Army, which cooperated with the Kokang Allied Forces, fought on the outside. The Ta’ang Army not only attacked Denni Town, but also successfully destroyed the nearby Nanda River Bridge to prevent the Burmese army from using the road to reinforce the Kokang. area. The Arakan Army and the Ta'ang Army attacked the Lashio area and once shelled the most important Lashio Airport in northern Myanmar, causing the grounding of civil aviation.

;

;Judging from the current situation, the Burmese military strongholds outside Lao Cai, the capital of Kokang, have basically been cleared. The attack and defense of Lao Cai will probably begin soon. Once the Kokang Allied Forces successfully regain control of Lao Cai Right, then this battle can basically be declared a victory. Compared with the Kokang war in 2015, the current Kokang Allied Forces are closer to their goal, which is to retake Lao Cai and regain control of the Kokang area.

;

;In the political narrative of the ethnic local armed forces in northern Myanmar, they are the positive heroes, and there are also evil villains accordingly. The villains this time are the four Guogan families. The four major families are the Bai family represented by Bai Chengcheng, the Wei family of Wei Chaoren, the Ming family of Ming Xuechang, and the Liu family of Liu Abao. The representatives of these four families are all powerful figures in the Kokang area and are the mortal enemies of the Kokang Allied Forces.

;

;From the perspective of the anti-telecom fraud narrative, the four major families are well-deserved as the villains. The companies of these four families have been operating telecom fraud businesses under the name of entrepreneurial parks for many years. , thus gaining a lot of wealth.

;

;In real international politics or regional disputes, the image of justice is part of the application of power. War is a continuation of politics, and politics often requires the blessing of morality. Destroying telecom fraud to save compatriots is not necessarily just talk. For the Kokang Allied Forces, as long as they successfully recover Kokang and completely eliminate the disgusting industry of telecom fraud, it is not a problem. After all, this is not their source of income. However, if it is said that the Kokang Allied Forces are only going to war to eradicate telecommunications fraud, that is not consistent with the facts. After all, this is not the first war between the Kokang Allied Forces and the four major Kokang families.

;

;Early on August 8, 2009, before northern Myanmar became a den of electronic fraud, Bai Suocheng, one of the later leaders of the four major families and deputy commander of the Kokang Alliance Army at the time, joined forces with the Myanmar army and other Three major families launched a coup and drove Peng Jiasheng, the first leader of the Kokang Alliance Army, out of the Kokang area.

;

;In 2015, after six years of dormancy, the Kokang Allied Forces launched a counterattack against the government forces in the Kokang region during the Spring Festival. At that time, the Kokang Allied Forces launched the attack in the name of returning home for the New Year.

;

;Therefore, not only was the last war not successful militarily, but it also did not have a high enough voice politically. It was even easily regarded by bystanders as a battle between warlords and interest groups. This time, the Kokang Allied Forces have grown for more than eight years. Their military, political, and propaganda capabilities are far better than before, and the results are likely to be very different.

;

;In fact, regardless of whether it is counter-terrorism or not, for the Kokang Allied Forces, being able to fight back their hometown of Kokang and regain control of the old street is the basis for their survival. The leader of the previous generation, Peng Jiasheng, died of illness in February 2022. The current Kokang Allied Forces, under the leadership of the current commander Peng Deren (Peng Jiasheng’s eldest son), has left his homeland to fight guerrillas for many years. But this is not a long-term solution. Without the support of their hometown and a solid base, it will be difficult for the team to develop and grow. Therefore, the military conflict that broke out on October 27, 2023, is equivalent to a battle for survival for the Kokang Allied Forces.

;

;;

;

;On January 4, 2023, in Naypyitaw, Myanmar, Chairman of the National Governing Council of Myanmar Min Aung Hlaing attended the military parade;(Visual China /Picture);

;

;;Looking at the Kokang from across Myanmar;

;

;In the eyes of those familiar with the background of the war in northern Myanmar, the Kokang Allied Forces this time It is expected to be invincible on the battlefield, because as early as 2021, an enemy far more deadly than the ethnic local armed forces in northern Myanmar appeared in Myanmar.

;

;On February 1, 2021, Myanmar political leader Aung San Suu Kyi was arrested by the Myanmar military at her home and was eventually sentenced to 33 years in prison. For Aung San Suu Kyi, who was already 78 years old at the time, this was tantamount to a life sentence. On the day Aung San Suu Kyi was arrested, large-scale street protests broke out across Myanmar. In the end, large-scale clashes broke out between demonstrators and military police. Many Western countries condemned the Myanmar military government and announced the restoration of comprehensive sanctions on Myanmar.

;

;At the same time, Aung San Suu Kyi’s political party, the National League for Democracy (NLD), was also banned by the military government. This series of actions basically announced the complete break between the Myanmar military government and the National League for Democracy. This caused the core political elites of the NLD and their supporters to completely cut off the possibility of parliamentary politics. The military government's violent suppression of demonstrations also caused Aung San Suu Kyi's supporters believed that the only way to fight against the military government was through force, so they announced the establishment of the National Unity Government of the Republic of the Union of Myanmar (Burmese abbreviation NUG). Its political proposition is to overthrow the military government through force and regain power.

;

;The NUG can be regarded as the NLD's government-in-exile, which announced the establishment of a military organization in 2021: the People's Defense Forces (PDF in Burmese). On September 7, 2021, NUG announced the launch of a "people's defense war" against the military government and called on citizens across Myanmar to resist the military government. For the Myanmar military government, this is undoubtedly a greater threat than the local ethnic armed forces in northern Myanmar.

;

;Since independence after World War II, Myanmar’s civil war has never stopped, but the armed forces of NUG PDF are different from the enemies faced by the previous Myanmar government forces. In past civil wars, the main enemies the Myanmar Army faced were ethnic minority armed forces in border areas, such as northern Myanmar and the Golden Triangle. Such armed forces may be powerful, such as the United Wa State Army, which has heavy equipment including anti-aircraft missiles and armed helicopters, or the Kachin Independence Army, which has sophisticated tactics and well-trained training. However, the characteristic of this type of army is that it is concentrated in areas where its ethnic groups are concentrated, and their political demands are only to maintain the independence and territory of their own ethnic groups. Therefore, the fighting between the Myanmar government army and these local ethnic armed forces is mainly concentrated in the northern region of Myanmar, which is the so-called Upper Myanmar. .

;

;Southern Myanmar, also known as Lower Myanmar, is mainly dominated by the Bamar people. The Bamar people account for up to 68% of the population of Myanmar and are the absolute majority of the population. It is difficult for local armed forces of ethnic groups in northern Myanmar to penetrate Entered Burma to fight. Politically, ethnic local armed forces have no such demands. The core members of the NUG are themselves Bamar political elites, and their main area of ​​activity happens to be in Lower Myanmar. Especially after the NUG established the armed forces PDF, the core members were sent to the Kachin and other ethnic local armed regimes to learn how to fight, and at the same time, they used Its underground network in lower Burmese society continues to carry out propaganda and mobilization. A large number of soldiers and officers with combat experience were absorbed into PDF. In recent years, the Myanmar government military academies have not only had difficulty recruiting students, but there have even been incidents of graduates taking their equipment and defecting to PDF. So far, at least 16,000 Myanmar military and police personnel have defected and joined PDF.

;

;In addition to poaching and gathering intelligence, PDF began to engage in guerrilla warfare with the Burmese army in lower Myanmar, and its organized combat units even appeared near Myanmar's capital, Naypyitaw, and the largest city, Yangon. In May 2023, the NUG announced the establishment of about 300 battalions and columns, banned the government agencies of the military junta in 250 towns and villages in Lower Myanmar, and established its own regime. In June 2023, NUG announced the formation of the 5101st Battalion, which was actually established in the Yangon area.

;

;Although the PDF has not had any decent results since its establishment, and has not successfully annihilated any Burmese army troops, its direct threat to the political and economic center of Burma in Lower Burma has forced the Burmese government forces to allocate Spend a lot of resources to defend against PDF sneak attacks. The NUG's intelligence and mobilization capabilities have also greatly weakened the Myanmar military government's ability to control Lower Myanmar. The reason why the PDF is considered more deadly than any ethnic local armed forces is because their military goal is not to occupy territory or support themselves with troops, but to completely destroy the Myanmar military government and regain power.

;

;If we look back at the Kokang conflict in 2015, we will find that the Myanmar government army could easily mobilize several brigades from Lower Myanmar to assist Kokang, while the air force could take off directly from surrounding airports to concentrate its forces. Attack the Kokang Allied Forces' positions. However, after the conflict broke out this time, the intensity and equipment level of government forces in mobilizing reinforcements were far lower than last time, and even air support was quite limited. The fundamental reason is that the mobile forces at the hands of the Myanmar military government are already stretched thin. If a large number of troops are deployed to support Kokang, the PDFs around Yangon and Naypyitaw will definitely take advantage of the situation.

;

;;

;

;On March 8, 2023, in Shan State, Myanmar, the Ta'ang National Liberation Army conducted military training;(Visual China/Photo);

;

;;Why is courage so important? ;

;

;For the Kokang Allied Forces, Kokang is of course crucial, because that is the only goal of this army at the moment.

;

;For the four major families of Kokang, Kokang is their political capital and a treasure trove of wealth. Losing Kokang means losing everything that two generations have worked hard for for decades.

;

;For the military government, Kokang is also crucial. The reason why the leader of the military government, General Min Aung Hlaing, stands out among many generals is because he successfully occupied Kokang and expelled Peng Jiasheng’s troops in 2009, making him He gained unprecedented prestige in the military and became the number one figure among the new generation of generals. Although Kokang is only the first special zone in Shan State with a permanent population of 140,000 and an area of ​​only 2,000 square kilometers, if it fails, the chain effect will be fatal.

;

;Therefore, from a political point of view, the Myanmar government forces will not give up Kokang easily, and will naturally try their best to support the local armed forces in Kokang to prevent the Kokang Allied Forces from succeeding in their counterattack. Therefore, although the Kokang Allied Forces made good progress in the early stage, it was still difficult to launch an actual offensive to retake Lao Cai. The price they are willing to pay to aid Kokang is the key to whether the Myanmar military government and the four major families can hold on to Kokang. If the level of military investment in the last Kokang conflict can be maintained, it may still be difficult for the Kokang Allied Forces to retake Lao Cai.

;

;;

;

;

;Shui Yang Shares ; (300740.SZ) ;, Yixian E-commerce ; (YSG.N) ;, Marumi Shares ; (603983.SH) ;Three rising stars ranked fifth, sixth and seventh respectively.

;

;;Research and development, it is the king of domestic products;

;

;Basically looking at revenue, Bethany can only rank It ranks third in the industry, but it firmly occupies the top spot in terms of technological innovation in the industry.

;

;Southern Weekend's enterprise scientific and technological innovation evaluation system covers R&D expenditure, R&D personnel, R&D investment proportion, intellectual property rights, core awards, and operating income from the three dimensions of R&D investment, R&D output, and company development. , operating profit, net profit, company market value and other nearly 30 subdivided indicators. The score of each indicator item is based on the ratio of the company indicator value to the highest indicator value of the industry indicator item.

;

;R&D investment, including R&D investment amount, personnel and intensity, is the most critical indicator on the list and is also the competitive advantage of Bethany.

;

;;;In 2022, Bethany’s R&D investment reached 278 million yuan, accounting for nearly a quarter of the entire industry, ranking among the top ten Among them, except for Shanghai Jahwa, the R&D investment amount of the other eight companies is less than half of that of Beitani. ;;In addition, its R&D investment intensity exceeds 5%, and the sales revenue achieved by applying core technologies accounts for more than 95% of the company's main business revenue. Volume research and development, had to accept it.

;

;;

;

;Beitaini was established in 2010, and its main brand Wei Nona was born in Dianhong Pharmaceutical ; (now acquired by Germany's Bayer Group);. The background of a pharmaceutical company and the "sensitive skin" track it chose determined the path of research and development of Winona Roll, and also set the tone for Bettany's high-level research and development.

;

;For a long time, China's sensitive skin market segment has been dominated by big European and American brands. Winona's ability to take a share of the big European and American brands is inseparable from its insistence on independent research and development.

;

;The Bethany Research Institute is the main platform for Bethany’s R&D innovation. In 2022, Bethany Research Institute established an innovative raw material R&D center based on the original functional cosmetics R&D center, established a systematic Yunnan characteristic plant active substance screening and evaluation system, and carried out a large number of functional research based on Yunnan characteristic plants. Independent research and development. As of the end of 2022, the company has successfully independently developed 40 functional cosmetic plant raw materials, exported 40 technical standards, and industrialized 11 Yunnan specialty plant actives including purslane and green thorn fruit.

;

;Independent research and development has created the product strength of its core brand Winona, and also laid the foundation for telling its brand story and creating a brand image suitable for sensitive skin.

;

;Proya, ranked second, has been a "constant winner" in the domestic product list in recent years, but it missed the championship in the science and technology innovation industry list, mainly due to insufficient investment in research and development.

;

;In 2022, Proya's revenue reached 6.385 billion yuan, ranking third in the industry after Shanghai Jahwa and Blue Moon Group. Its R&D investment amounted to 128 million yuan, also ranking third. , but its R&D investment intensity is only 2%, ranking fourth from the bottom. Even Yixian e-commerce, which is often criticized for "emphasis on marketing but not on R&D," has an R&D investment intensity of 3.51%.

;

;;Old domestic products, struggling to transform;

;

;Shanghai Jahwa, ranked third, is the first to develop in China The beauty and personal care group includes old brands founded in the 20th century such as Herborist and Maxam, as well as a new brand Yuze that focuses on sensitive skin. With a relatively complete product matrix, Shanghai Jahwa ranks first in the industry with revenue of 7.1 billion yuan.

;

;As one of the oldest domestic products, Shanghai Jahwa’s online channel layout and innovative marketing methods are not as good as those of new brands. In 2022, its online channels will account for less than 40% of total revenue, while cosmetics companies such as Bettany, Proya and Shuiyang Shares will account for more than 80% during the same period.

;

;The emphasis on offline channels may be closely related to the high market share of Shanghai Jahwa’s personal care and home cleaning brand. Compared with marketing, the old brand seems to be more willing to invest in product research and development than most new brands.

;

;Shanghai Jahwa’s R&D investment in 2022 will be approximately 180 million yuan, ranking second in the industry after Beitani. Its research and development directions cover a wide range of areas, including medical research co-creation, traditional Chinese medicine and herbal medicine, cell biology, safety and efficacy assessment equipment, packaging design, AI customization and beauty instrument platforms. In the annual reports of other companies, the content of AI is usually related to sales channels, but in Shanghai Jahwa, AI is truly related to products and services.

;

;If Shanghai Jahwa’s transformation and upgrading is the blessing of digital intelligence and biotechnology to its main business; the fourth-ranked old domestic product Mingchen Health is launching a dual business model.

;

;In fiscal year 2022, Mingchen Health invested 110 million yuan in research and development, and also invested in daily chemical products and game business. Of the 23 R&D investment projects disclosed during the same period, nearly half were game R&D; R&D personnel increased by nearly 80% year-on-year to 520, mainly due to new additions to the game business segment.

;

;Mingchen Health developed the game business through acquisitions in 2020. In 2021, the revenue of the game business and the daily chemical business will account for 37%. ;

;Among the 16 daily chemical companies, only 5 including Betteni, Proya, Mingchen Health, Pepperl+Jie, and Blue Moon Group achieved year-on-year revenue growth in fiscal 2022. In fact, the revenue of Mingchen Health's daily chemical products also declined year-on-year, but thanks to the doubling of game business revenue, the overall revenue increased.

;

;The gross profit margin of Mingchen’s health game business will reach 73.55% in 2022, while the gross profit margin of the daily chemical business will be only 33.75%. In a period of industry involution, decisively exploring new businesses is a new path.

;

;Qingdao Golden King, the largest source of revenue in 2022 will no longer be cosmetics, but new material candles, aromatherapy and handicrafts. Diversified development is another option.

;

;;Is high R&D investment worth it? ;

;

; Putting aside these transformations and career changes, focusing on the daily chemical industry itself, is high R&D investment a necessary choice?

;

;From the perspective of business operations, R&D investment is a cost account of the enterprise. Compared with industries with strong technological attributes such as software services and consumer electronics, the benefits that R&D can bring to daily chemical companies are not immediate. At the same time, R&D investment is not high, and there are many brands that have achieved substantial revenue through marketing.

;Looking at the annual reports of listed daily chemical companies, all of them have sales expenses higher than R&D expenses. ;

;Although compared with big European and American brands, the prices of domestic cosmetics still have room to rise, but behind this incident is the fact that the "hard work" of domestic brand marketing cannot support their price increases. The reason why consumers don’t buy the “79 yuan eyebrow pencil” is ultimately because they question the value of the product.

;

;The value of consumer goods usually includes brand value and functional value. The formation of brand value requires the accumulation of time, but functional value can be obtained by latecomers through research and development. For domestic brands whose brand value has not yet been formed, strengthening research and development is not only to create the functional value of the product, but also is conducive to the formation of its brand image. Winona is an example of "focusing on research and development" as the direction of brand development.

;

;;;Secondly, R&D is the only way to create new growth points. ;;This is especially true in the cosmetics industry.

;

;In the past, channels have always been king in China’s beauty and skin care industry. Thanks to the development of social media, the degree of information asymmetry between consumers and businesses has been greatly reduced. Consumers have begun to pay more attention to the efficacy of products. It has become a trend to buy skin care products based on their ingredients. The beauty and skin care industry has entered a stage driven by product efficacy. new era. Launching functional skin care products and creating a matrix of functional products have become a new battlefield for cosmetics companies to compete for market share.

;

;The efficacy of beauty products, especially skin care products, is closely related to product raw materials and formulas, and the discovery and invention of raw materials and formulas are undoubtedly inseparable from R&D investment.

;

;In addition, as functional skin care has become a new selling point, coupled with the popularity of medical beauty, biopharmaceutical companies with inherent advantages in formula research and development and targeted "medicine" have also begun to join the "involution" of the beauty industry .

;

;;Biotechnology, cross-border competition;

;

;Some people may have noticed that holding Mibel, Huaxi Biotech ; (688363.SH);, which owns cosmetics brands such as Quadi and Runbaiyan, did not appear on the list. It does not participate in the daily chemical industry rankings, but it is an important competitor of companies in the daily chemical industry.

;

;Bloomage Biotech, founded in 2000, has entered the skin care industry since 2016 and has ranked first in the hyaluronic acid business in the industry. In 2022, its functional skin care products achieved revenue of 4.607 billion yuan, a year-on-year increase of 38.80%, accounting for 72.45% of the company's main business revenue. This revenue is even higher than the total revenue of Shuiyang Co., Ltd., the parent company of Yunifang.

;

;;

;

;Similar to this, there are giant creatures ; (02367.HK)

; span>;, one of its main businesses is functional skin care products. Its brands include Kefumei, Kelijin, etc. Its revenue in fiscal year 2022 reached 2.364 billion yuan, of which functional skin care products accounted for more than 60%.

;

;At the same time, the daily chemical industry is also actively moving closer to biotechnology. Marubi Co., Ltd. proposed a research and development plan based on recombinant collagen in the next ten years in 2022. It plans to successively launch recombinant collagen products with Class II medical device certification, recombinant collagen water-light injection products with Class III medical device certification, and Class III medical devices. Certified collagen-filling products and artificial corneas based on recombinant collagen.

;

;;;In fact, the biotechnology and daily chemical industries are going in both directions. The intersection of medicine and beauty is getting closer and closer, and beauty and skin care products are moving closer to biotechnology from formulas and ingredients to technology to packaging. ;; Technologies such as fermentation engineering and molecular biology enable the extraction and development of new active ingredients; technologies such as nanotechnology and micro-emulsification technology are used to overcome the problem of difficulty in skin absorption; degradable packaging materials play an important role in environmental protection policies promoted to the market.

;

;Integrate product research and development with biotechnology in an all-round way, integrating industry, academia and research. In the fields of precision skin care, functional skin care and other fields, beauty and skin care brands have cultivated their own competitiveness by deeply cultivating biotechnology, and new brands are also seizing the opportunity. Technological changes are coming.

;

;Looking back at the development history of international beauty giants such as L'Oreal, Estee Lauder, and Shiseido, their origins and the establishment of moats are all closely related to chemistry and biomedicine.

;

;At a time when consumption is downgrading and national trends are prevalent, domestic beauty and cosmetics companies that have always focused on "high quality and low price" are facing important competition points to narrow the gap with big European and American brands.

;

;To seize this "overwhelming wealth", domestic beauty products must examine and learn from the original research and development intentions of European and American brands, and must not use high marketing as a basis to increase prices at will. After all, the company is not in a In the advertising industry, what makes consumers perceive value is not the gorgeous packaging and advertising endorsements, but the genuine effects that the products bring to consumers.

; Fri, 03 Nov 2023 14:25:03 +0800 小学老师因不堪非教育负担而自杀：当减轻乃至消除老师的非教育任务负担http://www.infzm.com/contents/259877

;The suicide of a primary school teacher attracted attention.

;

;Lv, a female teacher at Jianxing Road Primary School in Guancheng District, Zhengzhou City, left a suicide note with the completion time marked at 23:44 on October 26. The suicide note said: Mom, I'm sorry, I really can't hold it on anymore... I feel like I can't breathe. I never thought that being a primary school teacher would be so difficult... School work, school activities, and leadership inspections make us graduates who directly become class teachers without training feel like we are in a cage, and the cage is shrinking little by little. We go to work every day with our last breath in mind. When can teachers only do the job of teaching and educating people? How can unhappy teachers teach positive and optimistic children?

;

;Lv is only 23 years old this year. He was admitted to the school in August to teach and serve as a class teacher. He has a "normally cheerful personality" and is in the best years of his life. What a tragedy for her family who loved her.

;

;First of all, this incident has sounded a wake-up call for us. We must care and pay attention to our family members, especially their mental state and values. We should relax as a family regularly, have heart-to-heart conversations, and tell each other’s confusions. and weakness: If some problems can be solved, then help solve them; if some problems cannot be solved, then at least relieve the pressure. The "normally cheerful personality" may be true, or it may be that he forced himself to perform in order not to worry his family and others.

;

;Teachers within the system are regarded by many as "iron rice bowls". They have a system and have a good social status, but in turn they may become barriers that restrict people: many people have passed the teacher certification examination, but find that they are not actually qualified. If you don't like or are not suitable for this job, and you don't dare to resign and look for another job, you are often worried that your family or outsiders will not understand you, and you feel that you do not cherish this hard-won opportunity.

;

;Only you know whether your shoes fit or not. Here, I would like to advise everyone, no matter what profession you are engaged in, you should respect your own intuitive feelings and don't care too much about other people's opinions. When it's time to change the track, change the track, and spend your life on meaningful and worthwhile things; holding on for dear life will only lead to greater and greater mental internal friction, consuming and annihilating your own vitality.

;

;Furthermore, this matter will inevitably lead to a question: Don’t teachers only have a few classes a day and two three-month vacations in winter and summer every year? Isn’t it enough to be admitted to the teacher establishment? "Going ashore" can we not work so hard or even lie down? Why are we so busy and tired?

;

;Technically, this can be described as the dark side brought about by the popularity of smartphones and instant messaging tools. Various WeChat home-school groups and DingTalk groups allow the will of schools and teachers to reach every family and every parent.

;

;At the beginning, the function of the home-school group was just that schools and teachers forwarded various educational tasks to parents, asking parents to help their children prepare for classes, check their children's homework, etc. This forced parents to invest time and resources. Go into your child’s learning. To a certain extent, the teacher is the leader of the home-school group. Their children are in the hands of the school and the teacher. How many parents dare to publicly refuse to cooperate? There is also competition among parents to please the teacher or at least not to offend the teacher. The benefit of this approach to teachers is that teachers and schools still have certain KPI performance, and parents’ input helps them achieve KPIs, so schools and teachers have incentives to do so.

;

;Slowly, this trick will become known to some departments, and the routine of "little hands holding big hands" will be summarized, which is to press down through the chain of education system-school-teacher. Ask parents to cooperate in completing various non-educational tasks, as these departments also have their own KPIs. As time goes by, more and more departments are found to be able to do this. Various non-educational tasks are handed down to parents through this chain, and occupy more and more time of schools and teachers. Parents Although it was unpleasant, the school and teachers also felt uncomfortable.

;

;In the above sense, through home-school clusters, schools have become the third grassroots governance organization besides village committees and neighborhood committees. Each department has penetrated the tentacles of power into every student through the school-teacher transmission link. Families, and the frequency and intensity of intervention far exceed that of village committees and neighborhood committees. You may wish to recall, how many times can you interact with the village committee or neighborhood committee in a year? Many people may not even have one. But whenever you have children in primary or secondary school, you often have to complete non-educational tasks for your children that are communicated to you through the school-teachers.

;

;In addition, other government departments will also second teachers to do various non-educational work offline. After all, teachers are public officials within the system and are more or less dependent on local finance, so they are easier to dispatch.

;

; "Sanlian Life Weekly" once published an article ""Squeezed out" to have a teacher establishment, they regret it. The article interviewed Zhang Xiaohui, a primary school teacher born in the 1990s. Another interviewee said: As a class teacher, you not only have to teach classes, but you also have to arrange class activities and class meetings, and connect with local communities, hospitals, fire stations, transportation bureaus and other government agencies. You will even be called up by the school leaders at two o'clock in the morning. Volunteering and these heavy tasks made her feel physically and mentally exhausted, which was contrary to her original intention of becoming a teacher, so she chose to resign.

;

;Therefore, in order to reduce or even eliminate the burden of various non-educational tasks faced by schools and teachers, there are strategies to reduce the salary under the kettle. The first is to forcibly disband various home-school groups. Unless students get into trouble or get hurt at school, schools and teachers are not allowed to contact parents. In this way, various educational and non-educational burdens on parents can be eliminated at once, which is conducive to the normalization and harmony of home-school relations; schools and teachers may also be exempted from various online non-educational tasks. Second, it is explicitly ordered that other government departments shall not use teachers as temporary workers or use them for free as temporary workers. In short, a two-pronged approach will reduce the non-educational burden on teachers both online and offline, so that teachers can concentrate on teaching and educating people.
